page.title: 19HOUSING, DERVOCK.
page.content: The population of our block is about 800, with around 230 houses. In the village of{Dervock}there are about 750 people and 200 houses in 8 avenues and streets. Most of the houses are owned and run by the{N.I. Housing Executive although about 10-20 % are owner- occupied.{Station View}is named after the station,(now converted to a modern bungalow), which was a stop on the now extinct{Ballycastle Railway. Millar {Avenue}is named after{Dr.Millar; {Travers Place}after{Travers McCartney, a well-loved landlord,who didn't press tenants for rent when payments fell behind!{Greystone Crescent}is named after a grey stone in the river. About 175 new houses have gone up since 1950. Some replaced old ones, most were additional. The remaining houses around Dervock are farm houses and rural dwellings.
